alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:22AM EST until February 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The forecast of moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At McConnelsville affecting Washington and Morgan Counties. For the Muskingum River...Moderate flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At McConnelsville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Several homes and businesses start to flood in and around McConnelsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The river has crested at 12.66 and is slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.4 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 01/05/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM EST or when the river falls below the moderate stage.
